turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Motor pool (neuroscience).
turn.1: What is the function of the motor pool?
turn.2: Primarily, this system frees higher centers of the CNS from having to signal specific contraction patterns for distinct levels of muscle contraction.
turn.3: What are some examples of the modulation of the motor pool?
turn.4: The level of synaptic input that higher centers provide to a given motor pool must determine the contraction strength, and this simplifies the process of contraction strength modulation.
turn.5: What are the advantages of the motor pool?
turn.6: This system allows for a very precise and consistent modulation of contraction strength from just increased or decreased levels of synaptic input: with additional motor units of increasing size, there will be a consistent and precise effect on the force of contraction.
turn.8: Another key benefit derived from the size principle is that smaller neurons will be fired more regularly and for a longer duration of time compared to larger neurons.
turn.10: These smaller motor units are more resistant to fatigue, and as such, are better suited to this role.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects of this article?
turn.12: There are several layers of differentiation and specialization to consider in the complicated development of motor pools.
